Detailed Description

template<typename T, typename Compare = std::less<T>, typename idx = unsigned int>
class indirect_heap< T, Compare, idx >

Define a reference-based heap over an array of existing data that can be accessed and modified while mantaining the heap properties.

Element indices can be pushed up to a maximum size.

Template Parameters:
T Type of the data stored in the k-vector.
Compare Type of the comparison object. Defaults to std::less<T>.
idx Type used for encoding data vector indices. Defaults to unsigned int, but can be reduced to short or char for small K values.

Build a mutable reference heap over an existing array.

Parameters:
data Array with data.
size Number of elements in data.
maxSize Maximum heap size (should fit in data).
c Reference to a comparison object used to define an order.

template<typename T , typename C , typename idx >
T & indirect_heap< T, C, idx >::pop (  )  [inline]

Pop the top element from the heap. Cost: O(log n).

Extract topmost element from the heap.

Returns:
Topmost element being extracted, or first element if heap is already empty.

template<typename T , typename C , typename idx>
bool indirect_heap< T, C, idx >::push ( idx  index  )  [inline]

Push an element into the heap. Cost: O(log n).

Insert a new element in the heap, if it fits. Since data is never modified by the heap, only existing data can be pushed into it, referenced by its index.

Warning:
Only one copy of the same object can be in the heap at the same time.
Parameters:
index Data array index of the element to push into the heap (0-indexed).
Returns:
true if successful, false if heap is full or the element is already on the heap.

template<typename T , typename C , typename idx>
bool indirect_heap< T, C, idx >::remove ( idx  index  )  [inline]

Remove an object from the heap. Cost: O(log n).

Remove the specified element from the heap.

Parameters:
index Index of the element in data array being removed from the heap (0-indexed).
Returns:
true if successful, false if index is not in array.

template<typename T, typename Compare = std::less<T>, typename idx = unsigned int>
idx indirect_heap< T, Compare, idx >::right_idx ( idx  index  )  [inline, protected]

Get the index of the right child of a node.

template<typename T, typename C , typename idx >
void indirect_heap< T, C, idx >::setData ( const T *  data  )  [inline]

Update the pointer to data. Same size and structure is assumed. May require to rebuild the heap.

Update the pointer to real data. Same size and structure is assumed. Rebuilding the heap may be required after this. NULL pointers are ignored.

Parameters:
data New pointer to data.

template<typename T , typename C , typename idx>
bool indirect_heap< T, C, idx >::swap ( idx  index1,
idx  index2 
) [inline]

Update the heap to reflect the swap of two elements in the data array. Cost: O(1).

Update the heap after two elements were swapped from the data array. Cost: O(1).

Parameters:
index1 Index of the first element in the data array (0-indexed).
index2 Index of the second element in the data array (0-indexed).
Returns:
true if successful, false if any of the indices is not valid or not in the heap.

template<typename T , typename C , typename idx>
void indirect_heap< T, C, idx >::swap_elements ( idx  i1,
idx  i2 
) [inline, protected]

Swap indices and references from a pair of elements.

Swap element indices both in the heap and the inverse permutation arrays.

Parameters:
i1 Index of the first element to swap (1-indexed).
i2 Index of the second element to swap (1-indexed).

template<typename T , typename C , typename idx >
T & indirect_heap< T, C, idx >::top (  )  const [inline]

Get the element in the top of the heap.

Returns:
Reference to the element in the top of the heap, or to the first one if the heap is empty.

template<typename T , typename C , typename idx >
idx indirect_heap< T, C, idx >::topIndex (  )  const [inline]

Get the data array index of the element being currently in the top of the heap.

Returns:
0-based index of the topmost element in the heap, or first one if the heap is empty.

template<typename T , typename C , typename idx>
bool indirect_heap< T, C, idx >::update ( idx  index  )  [inline]

Update the heap with the new value of an object. Cost: O(log n).

Update the heap structure after a item has been modified. Cost: O(log n)

Parameters:
index Index of the item in the array that was modified (0-indexed).
Returns:
true if successful, false if index is not in array.

template<typename T , typename C , typename idx >
void indirect_heap< T, C, idx >::updateAll (  )  [inline]

Build the heap stucture again. Cost: O(n).

Rebuild the heap structure completely. Designed to be used when many elements have been modified. Cost: O(n), better than O(n log n) from n individual updates.
